title: Gallery Talk: Ceramic Wars—Capturing Imperfection
hero_caption: Korea. Moon Jar, Joseon dynasty (1392–1910), 17th century. Gift of an anonymous donor, Louise Lutz Estate, and Russell Tyson Endowment.
short_description: Join educator Saira Chambers to explore the violent history of Korean ceramic traditions, and their important role in the production of Japanese teaware and the aesthetics of imperfection.
description:
Join educator Saira Chambers to explore the violent history of Korean ceramic traditions, and their important role in the production of Japanese teaware and the aesthetics of imperfection.

Please note that the subject of this talk is different than what was originally published.

(Please note that the artwork on this page may not be featured during the gallery talk.)
